content:
So today is 2021-12-11 (at least here in germany :upside_down: ) and when I do rustup updateit shows the last available nightly as
nightly-x86_64-unknown-linux-gnu unchanged - rustc 1.59.0-nightly (0b42deacc 2021-12-09)
There is no warning like "nightly is missing component xy" so I wonder what happened to 2021-12-11 ...?

We had some commits merged on Dec 10 according to github https://github.com/rust-lang/rust/commits/master so there should theoretically be a -10 nightly think?
Is there still something wrong with the aarch runners maybe?
No commit was actually merged on Dec 10
Bors commits are created when CI starts running on a PR, not when it's merged
If you check the merge date in the PR it's on Dec 11
